name: Extension
title: CS Extension
notes:
**Note 1**:  Impaired vocal cord mobility may be described as vocal cord paresis, and may suggest invasion of intrinsic laryngeal muscle.  Fixation of the vocal cord maybe described as immobility of the arytenoids noted on endoscopy, paralysis of the vocal cords, or deviation of larynx to the fixed side.

**Note 2**:  Use code 450 for localized tumor ONLY if no information is available to assign codes 100 through 400.

**Note 3**:  Use code 775, 810, or 815 if the physician's assignment of T category is the ONLY information available about the extent of the tumor.
rows:
Invasive tumor with normal vocal cord mobility confined to subglottis

Stated as T1 with no other information on extension

Tumor involves adjacent regions(s) of larynx:
    Supraglottis
    Glottis
WITH normal or impaired mobility

Stated as T2 with no other information on extension

Tumor limited to larynx 
WITH vocal cord fixation
 
Stated as T3 with no other information on extension

Base of tongue
Hypopharynx, NOS
Postcricoid area
Pre-epiglottic tissues
Pyriform sinus (pyriform fossa)
Vallecula
Extension to/through cricoid cartilage or thyroid cartilage

Extension to/through:
    Cervical esophagus
    Deep extrinsic muscles of tongue
    Strap muscles:
        Omohyoid
        Sternohyoid
        Sternothyroid
        Thyrohyoid
    Oropharynx
    Skin
    Soft tissues of neck
    Thyroid gland
    Trachea

OBSOLETE DATA CONVERTED V0200
See code 800

Contiguous extension to other tissues beyond larynx not specified in codes 700 or 800
Stated as T4a with no other information on extension

Further contiguous extension including:
    Mediastinal structures
    Prevertebral space
    Carotid artery (encased)
Stated as T4b with no other information on extension
Stated as T4 [NOS] with no other information on extension

Unknown; extension not stated
Primary tumor cannot be assessed
Not documented in patient record
